Award.AwardTitle: Travel and Registration Support for Computer Aided Verification 2015

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration: This award will support student travel to the 2015 27th International Conference on Computer Aided Verification(CAV). The conference will be held in San Francisco, California on July 18-24 2015. Supporting student travel to attend professional conferences and workshops is a very important mission of the NSF. Verification technology is being rapidly deployed in a variety of areas both in academic research as well as in industrial systems. Thus the broader significance and importance includes fostering the next generation of researchers in this research area, as well as providing international experiences to build a globally-aware workforce. In particular, students will have the opportunity to learn state-of-the-art methodologies, be exposed to novel techniques, and interact with senior researchers in their areas of expertise.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Report on CAV'15 student participants who were sponsored by NSF

 

 

 

This report gives information on the students who attended CAV'15 sponsored by NSF. CAV'15 was the 27th in a series dedicated to the advancement of the theory and practice of computer-aided formal analysis methods for hardware and software systems. The conference covered the spectrum from theoretical results to concrete applications, with an emphasis on practical verification tools and the algorithms and techniques that are needed for their implementation. CAV'15 was held on July 18-24, 2015, in San Francisco, California.

 

NSF awarded $10000 which were spent evenly on the following 10 students ($1000 each) all PhD level:

 

  •  Mitesh Jain, jmitesh@ccs.neu.edu, Northeastern University
  • Anvesh Komouravelli, anveshk12@gmail.com, Carnegie Mellon University
  • Jinseong Jeon, jsjeon@cs.umd.edu, University of Maryland, College Park
  • He Zhu, zhuhemail@gmail.com, Purdue University
  • Muralidaran Vijayaraghavan, vmurali@csail.mit.edu, Massachusetts Institute of Technology
  • Kshitij Bansai, kshitij@cs.nyu.edu, New York University
  • Abhinav Aggarwal, abhiag@cs.unm.edu, University of New Mexico
  • Andreas Katis, katis001@umn.edu, University of Minnesota
  • Shaobo He, shaobo@cs.utah.edu, University of Utah
  • Min Gao, tomhacker821@gmail.com, UCLA

 

The students were selected based on recommendations from their advisers and on weather they had a paper or not to be presented at CAV. The selection committee was led by Teme Kahsai (CAV'15 Local Chair).
